text: Ruby, Don't Take Your Love to Town is the fourth album by the group The First Edition. This was the first album to credit the group as Kenny Rogers & The First Edition. The title song reached number 6 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the United States (and was a success mirrored world-wide). "Reuben James" became a top-30 hit in 1969 for The First Edition before also being recorded by Conway Twitty for his 1970 Hello Darlin' album. ==Track listing== #"Ruby, Don't Take Your Love to Town" (Mel Tillis) #"Me and Bobby McGee" (Kris Kristofferson) #"New Design" (P.F.
